BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: An appreciable danger of wet snow slides and avalanches exists.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Continuous warming. Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be good. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to increasing moistening of the snowpack.
Small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized moist and wet avalanches are possible below approximately 2800 m. This applies in particular in gullies and bowls, as well as on very steep southeast, south facing slopes.
Individual gliding avalanches are possible, in particular on very steep grassy slopes below approximately 2600 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.
Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.

The hard wind slabs are easy to recognise but can be released in isolated cases. The avalanche prone locations are to be found also in places that are some distance from ridgelines and in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The weather will be mild. Above the tree line snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.
Especially on steep sunny slopes as well as below approximately 2200 m less snow than usual is lying. Also adjacent to ridgelines hardly any snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The danger of moist and wet avalanches will persist.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: More moist avalanches are possible as the day progresses. In addition the clearly visible wind slabs should be taken into account.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be good. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to slight moistening of the snowpack on sunny slopes, caution is to be exercised in particular on very steep slopes below approximately 2600 m, and at the base of rock walls. In steep gullies moist avalanches can reach medium size.
The wind slabs of the last few days are lying on weak layers in high Alpine regions. They can still be released in some cases in particular on north to east to southeast facing aspects above approximately 2500 m.
There is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface. This applies in particular in the early morning.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The conditions are wintry at high altitude. Individual weak layers exist in the snowpack on wind-loaded slopes. Adjacent to ridgelines hardly any snow is lying.
Low and intermediate altitudes and very steep sunny slopes: The conditions are spring-like. Less snow than usual is lying. The high temperatures gave rise to moistening of the snowpack below approximately 2500 m.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather will be mild. The meteorological conditions will foster a gradual strengthening of the near-surface layers.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Increase in danger of moist and wet avalanches in the course of the day.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Continuous warming. Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be good. The backcountry touring conditions in the morning, after a clear night, are favourable.
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to increasing moistening of the snowpack. Medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large moist and wet avalanches are possible below approximately 2800 m. This applies in particular in gullies and bowls, as well as on very steep east, southeast and south facing slopes.
More gliding avalanches are possible, in particular on very steep grassy slopes below approximately 2600 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.
Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.

The hard wind slabs are easy to recognise but can be released in isolated cases. The avalanche prone locations are to be found also in places that are some distance from ridgelines and in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. Skiers can release avalanches in isolated cases, including medium-sized ones.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The weather will be mild.
Below approximately 2300 m, south facing slopes: Towards its surface, the snowpack is hard and its surface has a strong melt-freeze crust.
Above the tree line snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. The upper section of the snowpack is unfavourably layered.
Since Wednesday numerous small and medium-sized avalanches occurred naturally. Naturally triggered avalanches and field observations confirm a sometimes precarious avalanche situation in particular in the regions with a lot of snow.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The danger of moist and wet avalanches will persist.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: In particular in the south and at the base of rock walls medium-sized moist loose snow avalanches are possible as a consequence of warming.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: As a consequence of warming and solar radiation, the natural avalanche activity will increase. Moist avalanches can occur naturally.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The old snowpack will become generally wet all the way through.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights:
The weather will be mild over a wide area. Over a wide area continuous warming to the high Alpine regions.
Backcountry tours should be concluded early.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming, the likelihood of natural moist avalanches being released will increase gradually in particular on steep sunny slopes. Medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large natural avalanches are possible.
The wind slabs can be released, especially by large additional loads,. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain and adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to significant moistening of the snowpack.
In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.
Below approximately 1500 m only a little snow is lying.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights:
The wind slabs of the last few days must be evaluated with care and prudence.
The prevalence of avalanche prone locations and likelihood of triggering will increase as the day progresses.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The snowpack will be subject to considerable local variations over a wide area. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls above the tree line. The wind slabs can be released, especially by large additional loads, in all aspects at elevated altitudes.
As a consequence of warming during the day, the likelihood of natural moist avalanches being released will increase gradually in particular on steep sunny slopes below the tree line. Medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large avalanches are possible.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The wind slabs are lying on weak layers.
In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface. The solar radiation will give rise as the day progresses to significant moistening of the snowpack.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Over a wide area further warming to the high Alpine regions.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Outgoing longwave radiation during the night was good. The danger of ground avalanches will already increase in the late morning. Wind slabs above approximately 2500 m.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: The fresh wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant on northeast to north to northwest facing aspects above approximately 2500 m. A few wet and gliding avalanches are possible.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Wind slabs can still in isolated cases be released by small loads and reach medium size. Careful route selection and spacing between individuals are recommended. As the day progresses as a consequence of warming there will be a rapid increase in the danger of wet avalanches to level 3 (considerable).

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: More moist avalanches are possible as the day progresses. Weak layers in the old snowpack can be released especially by large additional loads on shady slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be good. As a consequence of warming during the day more small and medium-sized moist snow slides and avalanches are possible below approximately 2600 m. Caution is to be exercised below very steep, sunny starting zones that have retained the snow thus far.
The wind slabs of the last few days are lying on weak layers in high Alpine regions. They can still be released in some cases in particular on north to east to southeast facing aspects above approximately 2500 m.
There is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface. This applies in particular in the early morning.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The conditions are wintry at high altitude. In particular adjacent to ridgelines snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.
Weak layers exist in the centre of the snowpack on steep shady slopes.
Low and intermediate altitudes and very steep sunny slopes: Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to increasing moistening of the snowpack below approximately 2600 m. The conditions are spring-like.
In particular at low and intermediate altitudes from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Moist snow slides and avalanches are possible.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Weak layers in the old snowpack can be released by people in particular on very steep shady slopes. The avalanche prone locations for dry avalanches are to be found in particular in the vicinity of peaks.
As a consequence of warming during the day individual small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized avalanches are possible below approximately 2600 m. This applies in particular in case of releases originating from very steep, sunny starting zones that have retained the snow thus far.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Weak layers exist in the centre of the snowpack on steep shady slopes.
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to slight moistening of the snowpack in particular on steep east, south and west facing slopes below approximately 2500 m.
On steep sunny slopes as well as at low and intermediate altitudes less snow than usual is lying.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of wind from northwesterly directions, sometimes avalanche prone wind slabs formed in all aspects. Avalanche prone locations are to be found in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain above approximately 1900 m.
On steep slopes more wet loose snow avalanches are possible as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: More recent wind slabs can be released easily, even by a single winter sport participant, above approximately 1900 m, especially at their margins. The spring-like weather conditions gave rise to moistening of the snowpack below approximately 2400 m. Snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. Weak layers in the old snowpack necessitate caution and restraint.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The wind slabs represent the main danger.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of a strong wind from northwesterly directions, sometimes easily released wind slabs formed. In addition the older wind slabs must be taken into account. More recent wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in isolated cases.
The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls in all aspects. In addition in particular at the base of rock walls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain, further mostly small natural avalanches are possible. As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation more mostly small wet loose snow avalanches are possible.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: More recent wind slabs are poorly bonded with the old snowpack above the tree line. The spring-like weather conditions gave rise to moistening of the snowpack. As a consequence of mild temperatures and the moderate to strong northwesterly wind, the snow drift accumulations have increased in size during the last few days. The snowpack will be subject to considerable local variations. Early and late morning: The snowpack is wet and its surface has a crust that is strong in many cases.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The conditions are favourable over a wide area.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of a sometimes strong wind from northwesterly directions, sometimes avalanche prone wind slabs formed. They are to be found in particular on northwest to north to east facing aspects above approximately 2400 m. Caution is to be exercised in particular on very steep slopes adjacent to ridgelines in high Alpine regions. Avalanches can reach medium size in isolated cases.

More gliding avalanches are possible, in particular on steep east, south and west facing slopes below approximately 2600 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
High altitudes and the high Alpine regions:
The northwesterly wind has transported the new snow and, in some cases, old snow as well. The fresh wind slabs are lying on soft layers at elevated altitudes. They are in some cases prone to triggering.
Towards its base, the snowpack consists of faceted crystals. The snowpack will be subject to considerable local variations above the tree line.

Intermediate altitudes: Early and late morning: The snowpack is wet and its surface has a melt-freeze crust that is strong in many cases.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The backcountry touring conditions are spring-like.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The wind slabs represent the main danger.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of a strong wind from northwesterly directions, sometimes easily released wind slabs formed. In addition the older wind slabs must be taken into account. More recent wind slabs can be released even by a single winter sport participant.
The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls in all aspects. In addition in particular at the base of rock walls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain, further small and medium-sized natural avalanches are possible. As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation small and medium-sized wet loose snow avalanches are possible.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: More recent wind slabs are poorly bonded with the old snowpack above the tree line. The spring-like weather conditions gave rise to moistening of the snowpack below approximately 2700 m. As a consequence of mild temperatures and the moderate to strong northwesterly wind, the snow drift accumulations have increased in size during the last few days. Snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. Intermediate altitudes: Early and late morning: The snowpack is wet and its surface has a melt-freeze crust that is not capable of bearing a load.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Very early morning: In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the icy crust.
As a consequence of warming during the day individual mostly small moist snow slides and avalanches are possible below approximately 2600 m. This applies in particular in steep rocky terrain.
Weak layers in the old snowpack can be released in isolated cases by winter sport participants in particular on very steep shady slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The snowpack is largely stable. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to slight moistening of the snowpack below approximately 2500 m.
In all regions only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Fresh and older wind slabs at high altitude. Moist snow slides are possible during the day.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The fresh and somewhat older wind slabs can be released in isolated cases, especially at their margins. Caution is to be exercised in particular adjacent to ridgelines in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain at high altitude. Mostly avalanches are small.

As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation individual gliding avalanches and moist snow slides are possible, but they will be mostly small.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Wind slabs are lying on soft layers in particular on steep shady slopes at high altitude. The old snowpack will be quite stable. Early and late morning: The snowpack is moist and its surface has a melt-freeze crust.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Wet and gliding snow require caution.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wet snow represents the main danger.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: As a consequence of warming individual mostly small wet snow slides and avalanches are possible above approximately 1800 m. Caution is to be exercised in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain, as well as on very steep sunny slopes. In high Alpine regions there will be only a slight increase in the danger. In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the icy crust.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The old snowpack remains subject to considerable local variations. At intermediate altitudes hardly any snow is lying. In high Alpine regions a little snow is lying. In gullies and bowls the wind slabs are larger. These are to be found especially at high altitude. The weather conditions will give rise to significant moistening of the snowpack also at high altitude. The surface of the snowpack will freeze, but a strong crust will not form and will soften during the day.
